title: Spectra - emission spectrum of a 4-level atom

content.description: Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> represents some energy states of a hypothetical, single-electron atom.
content.question: Figures <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> each represent part of the emission spectrum for a hypothetical atom consisting of a nucleus and a single electron. For figures <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, \(E_0=hf_0\). Which of the following indicates whether Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> or Figure <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> corresponds to the energy states in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, because the emission spectrum contains all nonzero frequencies that correspond to all nonzero energy states.

Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, because the emission spectrum contains all frequencies that correspond to all energy differences between the lowest energy state and a different energy state.
Figure <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, because the emission spectrum contains all frequencies that correspond to the energy differences between all pairs of energy states.

Figure <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, because the emission spectrum contains the frequency and integer multiples of that frequency that correspond to the energy difference between the lowest energy state and the adjacent energy state.

content.answer: Figure <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, because the emission spectrum contains all frequencies that correspond to the energy differences between all pairs of energy states.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
